title: Sweet Potato Lentil Curry with Crispy Sesame Chickpeas.
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'shallots, finely chopped', 'fresh ginger, grated', 'sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed', 'Thai red curry paste', 'low-sodium vegetable broth', 'dried red lentils', 'fish sauce', 'low sodium soy sauce', 'creamy peanut butter', 'full fat coconut milk', 'baby spinach', 'juice from 1 lime', 'fresh cilantro, chopped', 'cooked basmati rice', 'pomegranate arils', 'sesame or extra virgin olive oil', 'chickpeas', 'low sodium soy sauce', 'raw sesame seeds']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'shallots, finely chopped': '2', 'fresh ginger, grated': '1', 'sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed': '2', 'Thai red curry paste': '3-4', 'low-sodium vegetable broth': '3-4', 'dried red lentils': '3/4', 'fish sauce': '2', 'low sodium soy sauce': '2', 'creamy peanut butter': '1', 'full fat coconut milk': '1', 'baby spinach': '2', 'juice from 1 lime': 'seasoning', 'fresh cilantro, chopped': '1/3', 'cooked basmati rice': 'seasoning', 'pomegranate arils': 'seasoning', 'sesame or extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'chickpeas': '1', 'raw sesame seeds': '1'}
instructions: ['1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. When the oil shimmers, add the shallots and cook 3 minutes until soft. Add the ginger and sweet potatoes and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Stir in the curry paste and cook another minute.', '2. Add the 3 cups broth, lentils, fish sauce, soy sauce, and peanut butter. Bring the mix to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer 15-20 minutes, until the lentils are soft and the sweet potatoes tender.', '3. Meanwhile, make the chickpeas. Heat a large, high sided skillet over medium heat. Add the 2 tablespoons oil and the chickpeas. Cook, stirring occasionally until the chickpeas are crisped all over, about 5 minutes. Add the soy sauce and sesame seeds, tossing to combine. Cook 1 minute, remove from the heat.', '4. When the lentils are cooked, stir in the coconut milk, spinach, and lime juice, cook 5 minutes. If your curry feels thick, add additional broth to thin. Remove from the heat and add the cilantro.', '5. To serve, divide the rice among bowls and ladle the curry overtop. Top with chickpeas, cilantro, and pomegranates. Enjoy!']

title: Slow Cooker Red Wine Sunday Ragù Pasta.
ingredients: ['bone in beef, short ribs', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'thick-cut bacon, chopped', 'dry red wine, such as Sangiovese', 'low sodium beef broth', 'cans crushed San Marzano tomatoes', 'can tomato paste', 'yellow onion, chopped', 'garlic, finely crushed or chopped', 'celery, finely chopped', 'carrot, finely chopped', 'fresh thyme, or 1 tablespoon dried thyme', 'fresh chopped sage, or 1 teaspoon dried sage', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'salted butter', 'fresh grated parmesan cheese, save the rind', 'dry pappardelle or tagliatelle pasta', 'burrata cheese, at room temperature, for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'bone in beef, short ribs': '4-5', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'thick-cut bacon, chopped': '3', 'dry red wine, such as Sangiovese': '1 1/4', 'low sodium beef broth': '1/2', 'cans crushed San Marzano tomatoes': '2', 'can tomato paste': '1', 'yellow onion, chopped': '1', 'garlic, finely crushed or chopped': '6', 'celery, finely chopped': '3', 'carrot, finely chopped': '1', 'fresh thyme, or 1 tablespoon dried thyme': '2', 'fresh chopped sage, or 1 teaspoon dried sage': '1', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1', 'salted butter': '1', 'fresh grated parmesan cheese, save the rind': '1/2', 'dry pappardelle or tagliatelle pasta': '1', 'burrata cheese, at room temperature, for serving': '8'}
instructions: ["1. Season the short ribs with salt and pepper. Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove the bacon. If there's excess bacon grease, drain off all but 1 tablespoon.\xa0Add the short ribs and sear on both sides. Remove the ribs and transfer to the slow cooker along with the bacon.", '2. To the slow cooker, add the parmesan rind, wine, broth, tomatoes, tomato paste, onion, garlic, celery, carrot, thyme, sage, red pepper flakes, 4 tablespoons butter, and season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.', '3. Once done cooking, remove the short ribs, let cool slightly, then shred the meat and discard the bones, parmesan rind, and thyme.. Add the shredded meat and parmesan, toss with the sauce. Keep on warm.', '4. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain and toss the pasta with 4 tablespoons butter.', '6. Divide the pasta between plates, add the ragù, and toss well. Top each serving with burrata and additional parmesan.']

title: Healthier 30 Minute Beer Braised Chicken.
ingredients: ['boneless, skinless chicken breasts', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'all-purpose flour', 'thick-cut bacon, chopped', 'small yellow onions, thinly sliced', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'pumpkin beer, or whatever you drink', 'diced fire-roasted tomatoes with chilies', 'apple butter or real maple syrup', 'red bell peppers, chopped', 'chili powder', 'smoked paprika', 'fresh thyme', 'cayenne pepper', 'fresh parsley, roughly chopped', 'cooked white or brown rice, for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'boneless, skinless chicken breasts': '1 1/2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'all-purpose flour': '1/3', 'thick-cut bacon, chopped': '3', 'small yellow onions, thinly sliced': '2', 'garlic, minced or grated': '2', 'pumpkin beer, or whatever you drink': '1', 'diced fire-roasted tomatoes with chilies': '1', 'apple butter or real maple syrup': '1', 'red bell peppers, chopped': '1', 'chili powder': '1', 'smoked paprika': '2', 'fresh thyme': '2', 'cayenne pepper': '1/2', 'fresh parsley, roughly chopped': '2', 'cooked white or brown rice, for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Place the flour in a shallow bowl and dredge the chicken through the flour, coating it completely.', "2. Set Instant Pot to sauté. title: Weeknight 30 Minute Coconut Curry Chicken Meatballs
ingredients: ['ground turkey or chicken', 'green onions, finely chopped', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'Worcestershire sauce', 'kosher salt and pepper', 'sesame oil, or extra virgin olive oil', 'medium shallots, finely chopped', 'red or orange bell peppers sliced', 'fresh ginger, grated', 'Thai red curry paste', 'full-fat coconut milk', 'low sodium soy sauce', 'fish sauce', 'fresh cilantro or basil, roughly chopped', 'toasted coconut and steamed rice, for serving', 'mango, diced', 'jalapeńo or red Fresno pepper, seeded and chopped', 'juice and zest from 1 lime']
ingredients with measurement: {'ground turkey or chicken': '1', 'green onions, finely chopped': '2', 'garlic, minced or grated': '1', 'Worcestershire sauce': '1', 'kosher salt and pepper': 'seasoning', 'sesame oil, or extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'medium shallots, finely chopped': '2', 'red or orange bell peppers sliced': '2', 'fresh ginger, grated': '1', 'Thai red curry paste': '2-3', 'full-fat coconut milk': '1', 'low sodium soy sauce': '2', 'fish sauce': '1', 'fresh cilantro or basil, roughly chopped': '1/4', 'toasted coconut and steamed rice, for serving': 'seasoning', 'mango, diced': '1', 'jalapeńo or red Fresno pepper, seeded and chopped': '1', 'juice and zest from 1 lime': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment.', '2. Add the chicken, green onions, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, and a pinch each of salt and pepper to a bowl. Mix until just combined. Coat your hands with a bit of oil, and roll the meat into tablespoon-size balls (will make 15-20 meatballs) placing them on the prepared baking sheet. The mix will be wet, but it will firm up in the oven. Transfer to the oven and bake for 15 minutes or until the meatballs are crisp and cooked through.', '3. Meanwhile, heat the sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat.\xa0Add the shallots, bell peppers, and ginger. Cook until the fragrant and the peppers softened, 5-8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.', '4. Stir in the curry paste and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the coconut milk, soy sauce, and fish sauce. Stir to combine, bring the mixture to a boil. Add the meatballs and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the cilantro.', '5. In a small bowl, combine the mango, jalapeño, lime zest, and lime juice.', '6. Serve the meatballs and sauce over bowls of rice topped with toasted coconut, spicy mango, and additional herbs.']

title: Jammy Cherry Tomato Pasta with Crisp Lemon Rosemary Chickpeas
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'chickpeas, drained and patted dry', 'fresh rosemary', 'thinly sliced lemon zest', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'linguine or other long cut pasta', 'cherry tomatoes', 'garlic, smashed', 'apple cider vinegar', 'fig preserves/jam or honey', 'salted butter', 'Tuscan kale, finely shredded', 'fresh basil, roughly chopped', 'fresh burrata cheese, at room temperature']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '1/2', 'chickpeas, drained and patted dry': '1', 'fresh rosemary': '3', 'thinly sliced lemon zest': '2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'linguine or other long cut pasta': '1', 'cherry tomatoes': '4', 'garlic, smashed': '3', 'apple cider vinegar': '3', 'fig preserves/jam or honey': '1', 'salted butter': '3', 'Tuscan kale, finely shredded': '1', 'fresh basil, roughly chopped': '1', 'fresh burrata cheese, at room temperature': '2'}
instructions: ["1. Heat a large, high sided skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil, chickpeas, and rosemary, and cook, stirring occasionally until the chickpeas are crisped all over, about 8-10 minutes. It's OK if some of the chickpeas are popping. Add the lemon and cook another minute, until fried. Remove the chickpeas, rosemary, and most of the lemon from the oil to a paper towel-lined plate. Season with salt and pepper. Set the skillet aside.", '2. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to package directions until al dente. Just before draining, remove 1 cup of the pasta cooking water. Drain.', '3. Meanwhile, place the skillet with the rosemary-infused oil still inside over high heat. When the oil shimmers, add the tomatoes, garlic, and a pinch each of salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Cook until the tomatoes begin to pop, about 4-5 minutes. Reduce the heat to low, add the vinegar, preserves or honey, and a splash of the pasta cooking water (3-4 tablespoons). Simmer 5-10 minutes, until the sauce reduces and is "jammy".', '4.\xa0Add the pasta, kale, and basil, tossing to combine. Crumble in the fried rosemary, reserving 1 sprig for topping. If needed, thin the sauce with additional pasta cooking water.', '6. Divide the pasta and butter (if using), among plates and top with burrata cheese, crisp chickpeas, crumbled rosemary, and lemon. Enjoy!']

title: Crispy Buffalo Ranch Chicken Salad with Goddess Dressing
ingredients: ['boneless chicken breasts, cutlets, or tenders', 'buffalo sauce, homemade or store-bought', 'Panko bread crumbs', 'dried chives and dried parsley', 'dried dill', 'garlic and onion powder', 'cayenne pepper, more or less to taste', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'romaine lettuce, shredded', 'carrots, shredded', 'celery stalks, chopped', 'Persian cucumbers, chopped', 'radishes thinly, sliced', 'fresh cilantro or parsley, roughly chopped', 'avocado, sliced', 'crumbled blue cheese or feta cheese', 'plain greek yogurt', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'fresh cilantro', 'fresh basil', 'jalapeño, halved and seeded', 'juice from 1 lemon']
ingredients with measurement: {'boneless chicken breasts, cutlets, or tenders': '1', 'buffalo sauce, homemade or store-bought': '1/2', 'Panko bread crumbs': '1', 'dried chives and dried parsley': '1', 'dried dill': '2', 'garlic and onion powder': '1', 'cayenne pepper, more or less to taste': '1/2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': '1', 'romaine lettuce, shredded': '2', 'carrots, shredded': '4', 'celery stalks, chopped': '4', 'Persian cucumbers, chopped': '2', 'radishes thinly, sliced': '4', 'fresh cilantro or parsley, roughly chopped': '1/2', 'avocado, sliced': '1', 'crumbled blue cheese or feta cheese': '1/2', 'plain greek yogurt': '1/2', 'extra virgin olive oil': '1/4', 'fresh cilantro': '1', 'fresh basil': '1/2', 'jalapeño, halved and seeded': '1', 'juice from 1 lemon': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. To make the chicken. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment.', '2. Toss the chicken with 2 tablespoons buffalo sauce. Add the Panko, chives, parsley, dill, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and a pinch each of salt and pepper to a medium-sized bowl. Stir to combine. Dredge the chicken through the crumbs, pressing firmly to adhere. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat until all the chicken has been used. Lightly brush/drizzle the chicken with olive oil. Transfer to the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Drizzle the chicken with the remaining buffalo sauce.', '3. Meanwhile, make the salad. In a large salad bowl, combine the lettuce, carrots, celery, cucumbers, radishes, and cilantro.', '4. To make the goddess dressing. Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth and creamy, adding water, 1 tablespoon at a time as needed, to thin the sauce.\xa0Toss the salad with a few tablespoons of dressing.', '5. To serve, divide the salad among bowls. To each salad add the chicken, avocado, and crumbled cheese. Serve with fresh chives, additional buffalo sauce, and additional goddess dressing. Enjoy!']

title: 20 Minute Ramen Carbonara with Herb Buttered Corn.
ingredients: ['thick-cut bacon, chopped', 'extra virgin olive oil or butter', 'corn, kernels removed from the cob', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'Kosher salt and black pepper', 'fresh basil, chopped', 'fresh thyme leaves', 'eggs, beaten', 'freshly grated parmesan cheese', 'ramen noodles, seasoning packets discarded']
ingredients with measurement: {'thick-cut bacon, chopped': '4', 'extra virgin olive oil or butter': '1', 'corn, kernels removed from the cob': '2', 'garlic, minced or grated': '2', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1/2', 'Kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'fresh basil, chopped': '1/2', 'fresh thyme leaves': '1', 'eggs, beaten': '2', 'freshly grated parmesan cheese': '1/2', 'ramen noodles, seasoning packets discarded': '3'}
instructions: ['1. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook the bacon until crisp. Remove the bacon from the pan and drain onto paper towels. Add the oil or butter, corn, garlic, red pepper flakes, thyme, and season with salt and pepper. Cook 5 minutes or until the corn is golden.\xa0Stir in 1/4 cup basil. Remove from the heat.', '2. Beat together the eggs, parmesan, and remaining 1/4 cup of basil, in a large serving bowl.', '3. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Boil the ramen according to package directions, until al dente. Before you drain the noodles scoop out about 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain.', '4. Immediately\xa0add the hot noodles to\xa0the egg/cheese mixture, tossing quickly (to ensure the eggs do not scramble) until the eggs thicken and create a sauce. The heat from the noodles will cook the eggs. Thin the sauce with a bit of the reserved pasta water, until it reaches your desired consistency.\xa0Add the corn and bacon, gently toss to combine. Season with freshly ground black pepper and salt.', '5. Divide the ramen among plates and top with fresh herbs. Enjoy!']

title: California Chicken, Veggie, Avocado and Rice Bowls
ingredients: ['boneless skinless chicken tenders', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'lemon zest', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'smoked paprika', 'onion powder', 'cayenne pepper', 'chopped fresh rosemary', 'fresh parsley or basil, chopped', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'red bell peppers, cut into fourths', 'zucchini, sliced into 1/4 inch rounds', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'avocados, mashed very well', 'juice of 1 lemon', 'fresh parsley, chopped', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'cooked basmati rice', 'cherry tomatoes, halved', 'toasted walnuts, roughly chopped', 'crumbled feta, goat, or blue cheese']

instructions: ['1. In a gallon-size zip-top bag or bowl,\xa0combine the olive oil, garlic, lemon zest, onion powder, cayenne, smoked paprika, rosemary, parsley, and basil. Season with salt and pepper. Add the chicken and toss well to coat. Marinate for 10 minutes or up to overnight in the fridge.', '2. In a gallon-size zip-top bag or bowl,\xa0combine the red peppers, zucchini, and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat.', '3.\xa0Set your grill, grill pan, or skillet to medium-high heat.', '4. Grill the chicken for 3-4 minutes per side, until chicken is cooked through and has light char marks. While the chicken is grilling grill the peppers and zucchini for 4-5 minutes on each side, or until charred. Remove everything from the grill and let cool 5 minutes. Once cool slice the red peppers into strips.', '5. In a medium bowl, combine the avocado, lemon juice, parsley, and garlic, and season with salt and pepper.', '6. To assemble, divide the rice among 4 bowls or plates. Top each bowl of rice with equal amounts of chicken, grilled peppers and zucchini. Add a large dollop of avocado and then add the fresh tomatoes and walnuts. Sprinkle with cheese (if desired). EAT!']

title: Spicy Peanut Noodles with Chili Garlic Oil.
ingredients: ['peanut oil or extra virgin olive oil', 'small shallots thinly sliced', 'garlic, thinly sliced or smashed', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'rice noodles or long cut pasta', 'creamy peanut butter', 'low sodium soy sauce or tamari', 'Gochujang', 'toasted sesame oil', 'rice vinegar', 'honey or maple syrup', 'fresh ginger, grated', 'bell peppers, thinly sliced', 'fresh basil, chopped, plus more for serving', 'fresh cracked black pepper']
ingredients with measurement: {'peanut oil or extra virgin olive oil': '1/3', 'small shallots thinly sliced': '2', 'garlic, thinly sliced or smashed': '4', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1-2', 'rice noodles or long cut pasta': '12', 'creamy peanut butter': '1/2', 'low sodium soy sauce or tamari': '1/2', 'Gochujang': '1-2', 'toasted sesame oil': '2', 'rice vinegar': '2', 'honey or maple syrup': '1', 'fresh ginger, grated': '1', 'bell peppers, thinly sliced': '2', 'fresh basil, chopped, plus more for serving': '1/2', 'fresh cracked black pepper': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. To make the chili oil. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the peanut oil, shallots, garlic, and chili flakes. Cook, stirring occasionally until the garlic is fragrant and toasted, 8-10 minutes. Remove from the heat, let cool, and carefully transfer the oil to a heat-proof bowl or glass jar.', '2. To make the peanut noodles. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the noodles according to package directions. Drain.', '3. Combine the peanut butter, soy sauce, Gochujang, sesame oil, vinegar, honey, ginger, and 1/4 cup water in a food processor or blender. Pulse until combined and smooth. Pour the sauce over the hot noodles. Add the bell peppers, basil, a large pinch of pepper, and 2 tablespoons chili oil. Toss to combine.', '4. Divide the noodles among bowls and serve topped with additional chili oil and basil. Noodles are delicious warm or cold. Enjoy!']

title: Bucatini Amatriciana
ingredients: ['bucatini pasta', 'chopped guanciale, pancetta, or chopped unsmoked bacon', 'sprigs fresh rosemary', 'crushed red pepper', 'San Marzano cherry or regular tomatoes', 'freshly cracked black pepper', 'freshly grated Pecorino Romano', 'fresh basil, for serving (optional)']
ingredients with measurement: {'bucatini pasta': '1', 'chopped guanciale, pancetta, or chopped unsmoked bacon': '1/4', 'sprigs fresh rosemary': '2', 'crushed red pepper': '1/2', 'San Marzano cherry or regular tomatoes': '3', 'freshly cracked black pepper': 'seasoning', 'freshly grated Pecorino Romano': '1/4', 'fresh basil, for serving (optional)': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Just before draining, reserve 1 cup of the pasta cooking water. Drain.', '2. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook the guanciale until just crisp and the fat has rendered. Add the rosemary and red pepper flakes, and cook until fried, about 1 minute. Slowly add the tomatoes, stirring to combine. Add the pasta and toss well, adding a splash of the reserved pasta cooking water, if necessary to bring it all together. Remove the pan from the heat and add the grated Pecorino Romano cheese and season to taste with pepper, and salt, if needed.', '3. Divide the pasta among plates and serve immediately topped with fresh basil and additional cheese, if desired.']

title: Lemon Parmesan Salmon

ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '1/3', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'salmon fillets': '4', 'smoked paprika': '2', 'garlic, minced or grated': '1-2', 'zest of 1 lemon': 'seasoning', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1', 'grated parmesan cheese': '1/4', 'fresh basil, roughly chopped': '1/2', 'fresh cilantro, roughly chopped': '1/4', 'fresh chopped chives': '1', 'crushed red peppers flakes': '1', 'chickpeas, drained': '1', 'grilled or steamed corn, kernels removed from the cob': '4', 'cherry tomatoes, halved': '2', 'crumbled feta cheese': '1/2', 'avocado, diced': '1', 'plain Greek yogurt': '1', 'fresh lemon juice': '2', 'kosher salt': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Place the salmon in a 9×13 inch baking dish. Add the paprika, garlic, lemon zest, crushed red pepper flakes, parmesan, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil, rubbing the seasonings and oil evenly into flesh.', '2. To make the yogurt sauce, combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix until smooth.', '3. Heat your grill, grill pan, or skillet to medium high heat. Place the salmon on the grill, skin side down. Add the chickpeas, corn, tomatoes, feta, and avocado, toss to combine.', '5. To serve, spread the yogurt sauce onto plates. Add the corn salad, then the salmon. Eat!']

title: One Pot 30 Minute Creamy Tomato Basil Pasta Bake
ingredients: ['dry fettuccine or other long cut pasta', 'salted butter', 'basil pesto, homemade or store-bought', 'marinara sauce', 'red enchilada sauce', 'oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, oil drained and chopped', 'goat cheese, crumbled', 'cubed fontina cheese', 'canned full fat coconut milk, or heavy cream', 'kosher salt and pepper', 'fresh mozzarella cheese, torn', 'fresh cherry tomatoes, halved', 'fresh basil leaves']
ingredients with measurement: {'dry fettuccine or other long cut pasta': '1', 'salted butter': '1', 'basil pesto, homemade or store-bought': '1', 'marinara sauce': '1', 'red enchilada sauce': '1/3', 'oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, oil drained and chopped': '1/2', 'goat cheese, crumbled': '4', 'cubed fontina cheese': '1', 'canned full fat coconut milk, or heavy cream': '1/2', 'kosher salt and pepper': 'seasoning', 'fresh mozzarella cheese, torn': '6', 'fresh cherry tomatoes, halved': '2', 'fresh basil leaves': '1/2'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', '2. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain the pasta and add it right back to the hot pot. To the pot add the butter, pesto, pasta sauce, enchilada sauce, sun-dried tomatoes, goat cheese, fontina cheese, and milk/cream. Season with salt and pepper. Gently toss everything together until a creamy sauce has formed, about 3-5 minutes. If your pot is not oven-safe, transfer the pasta to a 9×13 inch baking dish. Scatter the mozzarella overtop the pasta.', '3. Transfer to the oven and bake for 10 to 15 minutes, then turn the broiler on and broil for 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is golden and bubbly.', '4. Remove from the oven and let sit 5 minutes. Serve topped with tomatoes and fresh basil. Enjoy!']

title: Summer Nicoise Salad.
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil, plus more as needed', 'oil-packed anchovy fillets, drained', 'garlic clove, grated', 'lemon juice', 'dijon mustard', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'mixed baby potatoes', 'asparagus, ends trimmed', 'corn on the cob, husked', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'fresh chopped greens, such as romaine or arugula', 'cherry tomatoes, halved if large', 'mixed Greek olives, pitted', 'radishes thinly sliced or quartered', 'tuna packed in olive oil, drained', 'avocado, sliced', 'mixed tender herbs, such as basil, parsley, thyme, and or dill', 'hard-boiled eggs, sliced']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil, plus more as needed': '1/3', 'oil-packed anchovy fillets, drained': '2', 'garlic clove, grated': '1', 'lemon juice': '2', 'dijon mustard': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'mixed baby potatoes': '1', 'asparagus, ends trimmed': '1', 'corn on the cob, husked': '3-4', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'fresh chopped greens, such as romaine or arugula': '4', 'cherry tomatoes, halved if large': '1', 'mixed Greek olives, pitted': '1/2', 'radishes thinly sliced or quartered': '6', 'tuna packed in olive oil, drained': '2', 'avocado, sliced': '1', 'mixed tender herbs, such as basil, parsley, thyme, and or dill': '½', 'hard-boiled eggs, sliced': '4'}
instructions: ['1. To make the dressing. Combine the olive oil and anchovies in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until anchovies have broken down into the oil and disintegrated, 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the garlic, tossing to combine. Mix in the lemon juice, mustard, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Taste, adding more salt, pepper, and oil as needed.', '2. To make the salad. Place the potatoes and a tablespoon of salt in a large pot and fill with water. Bring to a boil over high heat and then reduce the to heat to medium, simmer 10-15 minutes or until the potatoes are just fork tender. Drain. Place the potatoes back in the hot pot. Cover the pot and let the potatoes steam for another 10 minutes.', '3. Meanwhile, pre-heat the grill to medium high heat. Toss the asparagus with olive oil and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Grill the asparagus for 3-5 minutes, turning 1-2 times throughout cooking, until light char marks appear.\xa0During the same time, grill the corn until charred all over, 5-8 minutes, turning 1-2 times throughout cooking. Once the corn is cool enough to handle, remove the kernels from the cob.', '4. While still warm, cut the potatoes in half and add to a large serving bowl, tossing them with half of the dressing. Arrange the salad greens, grilled asparagus, corn kernels, tomatoes, olives, radishes, tuna, and avocado around the potatoes. Drizzle the remaining dressing over the salad. Top with fresh herbs and eggs, if using. Serve slightly warm or at room temp.']

title: Cajun Pepper Shrimp with Creamed Corn Orzo.
ingredients: ['salted butter', 'corn kernels, removed from the cob', 'fresh thyme leaves', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'dry orzo pasta', 'dry white wine such as Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc', 'canned coconut cream or heavy cream', 'grated parmesan or Asiago cheese', 'large shrimp, peeled and deveined, tail on or off', 'cajun seasoning', 'uncooked Andouille sausage links, meat removed from casings', 'bell peppers, sliced', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'juice from 1 lemon', 'fresh basil roughly chopped']
ingredients with measurement: {'salted butter': '4', 'corn kernels, removed from the cob': '4', 'fresh thyme leaves': '3', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'dry orzo pasta': '1', 'dry white wine such as Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc': '1/3', 'canned coconut cream or heavy cream': '1/2', 'grated parmesan or Asiago cheese': '1/2', 'large shrimp, peeled and deveined, tail on or off': '1', 'cajun seasoning': '1', 'uncooked Andouille sausage links, meat removed from casings': '1', 'bell peppers, sliced': '2', 'extra virgin olive oil': '1', 'garlic, minced or grated': '2', 'juice from 1 lemon': 'seasoning', 'fresh basil roughly chopped': '1/4'}
instructions: ['1. To make the orzo. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the butter, the corn, 2 tablespoons thyme, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Cook 5 minutes or until the corn is golden.\xa0Stir in the orzo and cook until toasted, about 2-3 minutes. Add the wine to the skillet and de-glaze the pan. Add the 2 cups water and bring to a boil over high heat. Simmer 8-10 minutes until the orzo is al dente. Stir in the milk and parmesan, cook another few minutes until warmed through.', '2. Meanwhile, make the shrimp. In a medium bowl, toss together the shrimp, cajun seasoning, and a large pinch of pepper.', '3.\xa0\xa0Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add the sausage and brown all over, about 5 minutes. Add the peppers and season with salt and pepper. Cook 5 minutes or until the peppers are soft and tender, remove the sausage and peppers from the skillet to a plate.', '4. Return the skillet to high heat and add the olive oil. Add the shrimp and sear on both sides until pink, about 2-3 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons butter, the garlic, and 1 tablespoon thyme, toss to coat and cook until the garlic is fragrant and caramelized, about 1-2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the basil, lemon juice, and reserved sausage and peppers.', '5. To serve, spoon the orzo onto plates, top with shrimp and peppers. Enjoy!']

title: Extra Sticky Kung Pao Cauliflower.
ingredients: ['large head cauliflower, cut into florets', 'cornstarch', 'canned full fat coconut milk', 'low sodium soy sauce or Braggs Liquid Aminos', 'hoisin sauce', 'real maple syrup or honey', 'rice vinegar', 'sesame or peanut oil', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'fresh ginger, grated', 'green onions, chopped, plus more for serving', 'crushed red pepper flakes, more or less to taste', 'black pepper', 'salted peanuts, chopped, plus more for serving', 'steamed white or brown rice, for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'large head cauliflower, cut into florets': '1', 'cornstarch': '2', 'canned full fat coconut milk': '2', 'low sodium soy sauce or Braggs Liquid Aminos': '1/3', 'hoisin sauce': '3', 'real maple syrup or honey': '2', 'rice vinegar': '2', 'sesame or peanut oil': '1', 'garlic, minced or grated': '2', 'fresh ginger, grated': '1', 'green onions, chopped, plus more for serving': '4', 'crushed red pepper flakes, more or less to taste': '1/2', 'black pepper': '1', 'salted peanuts, chopped, plus more for serving': '1/4', 'steamed white or brown rice, for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1.\xa0Preheat the broiler to high. Line a baking sheet with parchment.', '2. In a large bowl, toss the cauliflower with 1 tablespoon cornstarch to coat. Add the coconut milk and 2 tablespoons soy say, tossing to evenly coat all the florets. Spread the cauliflower in an even layer on the prepared baking sheet. Transfer to the oven and broil for 3-4 minutes, until the cauliflower is just beginning to char on the edges.\xa0Reduce the oven temp to 425 and bake another 5 minutes, until just tender.', '3. Meanwhile, make the sauce. Combine the remaining 1/3 cup soy sauce, hoisin sauce, honey, vinegar, crushed red pepper flakes, and a pinch of pepper. Add 1/4 cup water and the remaining 1 tablespoons cornstarch, whisking until combined and smooth.', '4. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic, ginger, and green onions, and cook 5 minutes or until fragrant.\xa0Stir in the soy sauce mixture and bring to a boil over medium heat. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low. Add the cauliflower and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in the peanuts.', '5. Serve the cauliflower and sauce over bowls of rice. Top with additional peanuts and green onions. Enjoy!']

title: Caramelized Onion and Balsamic Tomato Tarts
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'yellow onion, thinly sliced', 'honey', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'garlic clove, minced or grated', 'fresh thyme leaves, plus more for serving', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese', 'shredded Havarti cheese', 'frozen puff pastry, thawed', 'cherry tomatoes', 'balsamic vinegar', 'fresh basil, chopped', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'egg, beaten', 'everything bagel spice, for sprinkling', 'fresh chopped chives']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'yellow onion, thinly sliced': '1', 'honey': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'garlic clove, minced or grated': '1', 'fresh thyme leaves, plus more for serving': '2', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese': '1', 'shredded Havarti cheese': '1/2', 'frozen puff pastry, thawed': '1', 'cherry tomatoes': '2', 'balsamic vinegar': '2', 'fresh basil, chopped': '1/4', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1', 'egg, beaten': '1', 'everything bagel spice, for sprinkling': 'seasoning', 'fresh chopped chives': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.', '2. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. When the oil shimmers, add the onions and honey and cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until softened. Season with salt and pepper and continue cooking another 5-10 minutes or until the onions are golden and caramelized. Add the garlic, and thyme, cook another minute.\xa0Remove from the heat.', '3. In a bowl, combine the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, the tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, basil, crushed red pepper, and a pinch each of salt and pepper.', '4. Lay the pastry sheet flat on a clean, floured surface. Gently roll the sheets out to stretch slightly. Cut each sheet into 4 squares and place onto the prepared baking sheet. Evenly top each square with onions, leaving a 1/4 inch border. Top with both kinds of cheese and then mound the tomatoes over the cheese, pressing them into the cheese to adhere slightly (see above photo).', '5. Fold the edges of the pastry inward to enclose the tomatoes. Brush the edges of the pastry with beaten egg and sprinkle with everything spice.\xa0Transfer to the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes or until the pastry is golden and the tomatoes burst. Top with fresh thyme and chives.']

title: One-Pan Cheesy Spaghetti Pie
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'dried oregano', 'dried basil', 'dried parsley', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'kosher salt and pepper', 'dry spaghetti', 'marinara sauce', 'eggs', 'whole milk ricotta cheese', 'shredded mozzarella cheese', 'grated parmesan cheese', 'fresh basil and/or oregano, for topping']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '1/2', 'garlic, minced or grated': '6', 'dried oregano': '2', 'dried basil': '2', 'dried parsley': '1', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1', 'kosher salt and pepper': 'seasoning', 'dry spaghetti': '1', 'marinara sauce': '1', 'eggs': '4', 'whole milk ricotta cheese': '1', 'shredded mozzarella cheese': '1 1/2', 'grated parmesan cheese': '1/2', 'fresh basil and/or oregano, for topping': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', '2. In a large 12-inch (or larger) oven-safe saucepan, combine the olive oil, garlic, oregano, basil, parsley, and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook over medium heat, stirring, often until the garlic is golden and caramelized, about 5 minutes. Carefully add the marinara sauce, 2 cups water, and season with salt and pepper. Add the spaghetti, breaking it in half if needed to make it fit in your pan. Increase the heat to heat to high. Bring the mixture to a boil. Stir frequently until the spaghetti is al dente, about 8-10 minutes.', '3. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine the eggs, ricotta, and parmesan.', '4. Remove the pasta from the heat and stir in the ricotta cheese mix. Top with mozzarella. Transfer to the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Top with fresh basil. EAT!']

title: Spicy Poblano, Black Bean, and Quinoa Enchiladas
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'sweet onion, diced', 'poblano peppers, sliced', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'jalapeños, seeded, plus diced', 'ground cumin', 'kosher salt and pepper', "Bob's Red Mill Organic Quinoa", 'red enchilada sauce, homemade or store-bought', 'black beans, drained and rinsed', 'fresh cilantro, chopped, plus more for serving', 'juice of 1 lime, plus lime wedges, for serving', 'corn or flour tortillas', 'shredded cheddar', 'shredded pepper jack', 'sliced avocado, yogurt, and pomegranate arils for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'sweet onion, diced': '1', 'poblano peppers, sliced': '2', 'garlic, minced or grated': '2', 'jalapeños, seeded, plus diced': '2', 'ground cumin': '2', 'kosher salt and pepper': '1', "Bob's Red Mill Organic Quinoa": '1', 'red enchilada sauce, homemade or store-bought': '3', 'black beans, drained and rinsed': '1', 'fresh cilantro, chopped, plus more for serving': '1/2', 'juice of 1 lime, plus lime wedges, for serving': 'seasoning', 'corn or flour tortillas': '10-12', 'shredded cheddar': '1', 'shredded pepper jack': '1/2', 'sliced avocado, yogurt, and pomegranate arils for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Heat\xa0 the olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. When the oil shimmers, add the onions and poblano peppers. Cook, stirring occasionally until the onions are caramelized, about 10 minutes. Add the garlic and jalapeños and cook 1 minute. Stir in the cumin, salt, and quinoa and cook 2 minutes longer. Pour in 2 cups water, bring to a boil, cover and reduce the heat to low. Cook 20 minutes or until the quinoa is fluffy. Remove from the heat and stir in 1 cup enchilada sauce, the black beans, cilantro, the lime juice, and 1/2 cup cheese.', '2.\xa0Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.\xa0Pour 1/2 cup of the enchilada sauce into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.', 'Pour 1/2 cup of the enchilada sauce into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.', '3. Wrap the tortillas in a damp paper towel and microwave for one minute. Spoon a little of the quinoa down the center of each tortilla, tuck and roll, placing the tortilla, seam side down, into the baking dish. Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over top of the enchiladas and then top with the remaining the cheese. Transfer to the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, until the cheese has melted. Remove and top with the avocado, yogurt, and pomegranate arils. Eat!']

title: Slow Cooker Potato and Cauliflower Curry
ingredients: ['Thai Red curry paste or Khao Soi Paste', 'cans coconut milk', 'low sodium veggie broth', 'low sodium soy sauce', 'pomegranate molasses', 'baby potatoes, halved if large', 'large head cauliflower, cut into florets', 'cinnamon stick', 'cumin seeds', 'kosher salt and pepper', 'fresh spinach', 'arils from 1 pomegranate for serving', 'steamed rice, cilantro, and limes, for serving', 'fresh naan, for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'Thai Red curry paste or Khao Soi Paste': '1/4-1/3', 'cans coconut milk': '2', 'low sodium veggie broth': '2', 'low sodium soy sauce': '2', 'pomegranate molasses': '1', 'baby potatoes, halved if large': '1', 'large head cauliflower, cut into florets': '1', 'cinnamon stick': '1', 'cumin seeds': '1/2', 'kosher salt and pepper': 'seasoning', 'fresh spinach': '2', 'arils from 1 pomegranate for serving': 'seasoning', 'steamed rice, cilantro, and limes, for serving': 'seasoning', 'fresh naan, for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. In the bowl of your slow cooker, combine together the curry paste, coconut milk, broth, soy sauce, and molasses. Add the potatoes, cauliflower, cinnamon, and cumin. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours or on high for 3-4 hours.', '2. Stir the spinach into the curry, cover and cook 5 minutes until wilted.', '3. Divide the curry among bowls and top with a handful of pomegranate arils, cilantro, and lime. Serve with rice and fresh naan. Enjoy!']

title: Butternut Squash and Brie Soup with Crispy Pancetta
ingredients: ['peeled, cubed butternut squash', 'garlic, smashed', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'honey', 'chopped fresh sage, plus more for serving', 'smoked paprika', 'cayenne pepper', 'cinnamon', 'kosher salt and pepper', 'whole milk', 'low sodium veggie or chicken broth', 'brie, rind removed', 'butter', 'thinly sliced pancetta', 'cream, for topping']
ingredients with measurement: {'peeled, cubed butternut squash': '5', 'garlic, smashed': '3', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'honey': '2', 'chopped fresh sage, plus more for serving': '1', 'smoked paprika': '1/2', 'cayenne pepper': '1/2', 'cinnamon': '1/2', 'kosher salt and pepper': 'seasoning', 'whole milk': '2', 'low sodium veggie or chicken broth': '2', 'brie, rind removed': '6-8', 'butter': '2', 'thinly sliced pancetta': '4', 'cream, for topping': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', '2. If needed, thin the soup with extra milk or broth. Taste and adjust seasonings as desired.', 'Bring the soup to a simmer over medium heat, stir in the brie and butter until melted and smooth. If needed, thin the soup with extra milk or broth. Taste and adjust seasonings as desired.', '4. Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook until crisp, about 2 minutes per side.', '5. Divide the soup among bowls and top with crisp pancetta, sage, and a drizzle of cream, if desired. Enjoy!']

title: Instant Pot Turkey Meatballs and Spaghetti Squash
ingredients: ['ground turkey or chicken', 'thick soft whole grain or white bread', 'egg', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'whole milk ricotta cheese', 'prosciutto, diced', 'dried oregano', 'dried cumin', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'kosher salt and pepper', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'crushed San Marzano tomatoes', 'red wine', 'spaghetti squash', 'parmesan rind, plus parmesan for serving', 'sprigs fresh thyme']
ingredients with measurement: {'ground turkey or chicken': '1', 'thick soft whole grain or white bread': '2', 'egg': '1', 'garlic, minced or grated': '5', 'whole milk ricotta cheese': '1/2', 'prosciutto, diced': '3', 'dried oregano': '1', 'dried cumin': '1/2', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1/2', 'kosher salt and pepper': '1', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'crushed San Marzano tomatoes': '2', 'red wine': '1/4', 'spaghetti squash': '1', 'parmesan rind, plus parmesan for serving': '1', 'sprigs fresh thyme': '2'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the broiler to high and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.', '2. Add the ground turkey to a medium bowl. Take the bread and run it under water until dampened, but not soaked. Gently squeeze the excess water out of the the bread and then crumble the bread over the turkey. Add the egg, 2 cloves garlic, ricotta, prosciutto, oregano, cumin, crushed red pepper flakes, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Coat your hands with a bit of olive oil, and roll the meat into 2 tablespoon size balls (will make 10-12 meatballs), placing them on the prepared baking sheet. Transfer to the oven and broil for 3-4 minutes or until browned.', '3. To the instant pot, add the tomatoes, remaining 3 cloves garlic, red wine, 1/2 cup water, and a pinch each of kosher salt and pepper. Poke the spaghetti squash all over with a fork. Place the spaghetti squash in the center of the sauce and then arrange the meatballs around the squash. Add the parmesan rind and thyme. Cover and cook on high pressure for 30 minutes or until the squash is easily poked through with a fork, this will depend on the size of your squash. Smaller might only need 15 minutes, while large squash might need 45 minutes.', '4. Once done cooking, use the natural or quick release function. Carefully remove the squash from the crockpot and transfer to a cutting board. Wipe away any grease and then carefully cut the squash in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds, then using a fork, scrape the squash into strands.', '5. Divide the spaghetti squash among plates and spoon the meatballs and sauce overtop. Top with parmesan and basil. Enjoy!']

title: Butternut Ravioli in Garlic Parmesan Broth and Hazelnut Pesto

title: 2 Ingredient Pumpkin Pasta with Balsamic Sage Butter Sauce
ingredients: ['pumpkin puree', 'all purpose flour', 'salted butter', 'garlic', 'fresh sage leaves', 'white wine', 'balsamic vinegar', 'kosher salt and pepper', 'manchego cheese and roasted pumpkin seeds for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'pumpkin puree': '1', 'all purpose flour': '4', 'salted butter': '1', 'garlic': '2', 'fresh sage leaves': '8', 'white wine': '1/2', 'balsamic vinegar': '3', 'kosher salt and pepper': 'seasoning', 'manchego cheese and roasted pumpkin seeds for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Generously dust a baking sheet with flour.', '2. In the bowl of a food processor, combine the pumpkin and flour and pulse until a dough forms. Alternately, this can be mixed by hand or in a stand mixer.', '3. Dump the dough out onto a flour surface and cut into quarters. Roll and cut the pasta into your desired shape by using either a pasta machine or rolling pin and a sharp knife. Transfer the cut pasta onto the prepared baking sheet. If not cooking right away, cover and refrigerate for up to 4 hours.', '4. Drop the pasta into the boiling water and cook until al dente, being careful not to overcook the pasta. Drain.']

title: Pumpkin Beer Broccoli Cheddar Soup
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'butter', 'small sweet onion, diced', 'carrot, diced', 'all-purpose flour', 'whole milk', 'low sodium veggie or chicken broth', 'pumpkin beer', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese, plus more for serving', 'bay leaves', 'freshly grated nutmeg', 'cayenne, or more to taste', 'kosher salt and pepper', 'broccoli florets', 'fresh thyme leaves, plus more for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'butter': '3', 'small sweet onion, diced': '1', 'carrot, diced': '1', 'all-purpose flour': '1/4', 'whole milk': '2', 'low sodium veggie or chicken broth': '2', 'pumpkin beer': '1', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese, plus more for serving': '3-4', 'bay leaves': '2', 'freshly grated nutmeg': '1/4', 'cayenne, or more to taste': '1/4', 'kosher salt and pepper': '1', 'broccoli florets': '4', 'fresh thyme leaves, plus more for serving': '2'}
instructions: ['1. Heat the olive oil and butter in a large pot over medium heat. When the oil shimmers, add the onion and carrot and cook until fragrant, about 10 minutes. Whisk in the flour and cook until golden, about 2 minutes, then gradually whisk in the milk until smooth. Add the broth, beer, broccoli, bay leaves, nutmeg, cayenne, and a large pinch each of salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer, reduce the heat to medium and cook, uncovered, until the broccoli is tender, about 20 minutes.', '2. Remove the soup from the stove. Remove the bay leaves and puree in batches in a blender or use an immersion blender.', '3. Return the soup to the stove and set over low heat. Stir in the cheese until melted and creamy. Add the thyme and cook another 2-3 minutes. Taste and adjust seasonings as desired. Laddle into bowls and top with a little extra cheddar and fresh thyme. Enjoy!']

title: Autumn Chicken Escabeche with Roasted Apples and Grapes
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'boneless chicken breasts, thighs or a mix', 'kosher salt and pepper', 'sweet onion, diced', 'garlic, smashed', 'cumin seeds', 'white wine', 'apple cider', 'apple cider vinegar', 'jalapeno or fresno chiles, sliced', 'bay leaves', 'thyme sprigs', 'apple, sliced', 'grapes']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '1/4', 'boneless chicken breasts, thighs or a mix': '1 1/2', 'kosher salt and pepper': 'seasoning', 'sweet onion, diced': '1', 'garlic, smashed': '2', 'cumin seeds': '2', 'white wine': '1 1/2', 'apple cider': '1 1/2', 'apple cider vinegar': '1/2', 'jalapeno or fresno chiles, sliced': '2', 'bay leaves': '2', 'thyme sprigs': '4', 'apple, sliced': '1', 'grapes': '1 1/2'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', '2. Heat the olive oil in a large dutch oven or cast iron skillet set over medium high heat. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. When the oil shimmers, add the chicken and sear on both sides until golden, about 3-5 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the skillet.', '3. To the same skillet, add the onion, garlic, and cumin seeds. Cook, stirring occasionally until the onion is fragrant and the cumin seeds toasted, about 8-10 minutes. Slowly pour in the wine, cider, and apple cider vinegar. Bring to a boil over high heat and then reduce to low. Slide the chicken back into the skillet, skin side up, it should be mostly submerged. Add the chile, bay leaves, and thyme. Sprinkle the apples around the chicken and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to the oven and roast for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven, add the grapes and return to the oven for another 10-15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.', '4. Let the chicken rest 5 minutes and serve with the sauce drizzled over the chicken with the roasted apples and grapes. Enjoy!']

title: Harvest Tomato and Butternut Squash Dal

title: Herby Buttered Wild Mushroom Tagliatelle Pasta
ingredients: ['tagliatelle or other long cut pasta', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'mixed wild mushrooms', 'kosher salt and pepper', 'butter', 'garlic cloves, smashed', 'fresh basil, roughly chopped', 'fresh thyme leaves', 'fresh chopped sage', 'dry white wine', 'fresh lemon juice', 'burrata cheese', 'shaved manchego cheese']
ingredients with measurement: {'tagliatelle or other long cut pasta': '3/4', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'mixed wild mushrooms': '1', 'kosher salt and pepper': 'seasoning', 'butter': '6', 'garlic cloves, smashed': '2', 'fresh basil, roughly chopped': '1', 'fresh thyme leaves': '2', 'fresh chopped sage': '1', 'dry white wine': '3/4', 'fresh lemon juice': '2', 'burrata cheese': '8', 'shaved manchego cheese': '1/4'}
instructions: ['1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain.', '2. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. When the oil shimmers, add the mushrooms and season with salt and pepper. Cook undisturbed for 5 minutes or until golden, stir and continue cooking until the mushrooms are caramelized, 3-5 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the butter, garlic, half of the basil, the thyme, and sage. Cook, stirring occasionally until the garlic is caramelized and fragrant, about 5 minutes.', '3. Slowly add the wine and then the lemon juice and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Stir the pasta into the sauce and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 3-5 minutes until warmed through. Remove from the heat and stir in the remaining basil, discard the garlic cloves.', '4. Divide among bowls and break the burrata over top each bowl. Top with manchego and herbs for garnish. Serve immediately.']

title: Cheesy Sweet and Sour Pomegranate Thai Chicken Enchiladas

title: Roasted Beef Tenderloin with Mushrooms and White Wine Cream Sauce.
ingredients: ['whole beef tenderloin, trimmed of fat', 'dijon mustard', 'peppercorns, crushed, or fresh balck pepper', 'kosher salt', 'cremini mushrooms, halved', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'salted butter', 'white wine', 'salted butter', 'chopped fresh thyme', 'heavy cream or whole milk', 'grated parmesan', 'kosher salt and pepper']
ingredients with measurement: {'whole beef tenderloin, trimmed of fat': '1', 'dijon mustard': '2', 'peppercorns, crushed, or fresh balck pepper': '1/4', 'kosher salt': 'seasoning', 'cremini mushrooms, halved': '16', 'extra virgin olive oil': '1', 'salted butter': '2', 'white wine': '1/2', 'chopped fresh thyme': '2', 'heavy cream or whole milk': '2', 'grated parmesan': '1/3', 'kosher salt and pepper': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Allow the beef to come to room temperature for at least 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F.', '2. Rub the beef with mustard and season generously with peppercorns and salt.', '3. In a large oven safe skillet, toss the mushrooms with olive oil, salt and pepper. Place the beef over the mushrooms and insert a meat thermometer. Add the butter to the top of the beef. Transfer to the oven and roast until the beef registers 120 to 125 degrees F for medium-rare/rare, about 25-40 minutes, dependent on the size of your roast.', '4. Remove the beef and mushrooms from the skillet to a serving plate and cover will foil. Let rest 10 minutes before slicing.', '5. Meanwhile, make the cream sauce. Place the same skillet used to roast the beef over high heat. Add the wine and scrape up any browned bits off the pan. Simmer 3-5 minutes or until the wine has reduce by about 1/3 to 1/2. Add the butter and thyme and continue cooking another 2 minutes until the butter has melted into the sauce. Slowly pour in the cream and bring the sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer 5 minutes or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Remove from the heat and stir in the parmesan. Season the sauce with salt and pepper.', '6. Slice the beef and serve with the warm cream sauce and roasted mushrooms.']

title: Oven-Fried Southern Chicken With Sweet Honey Bourbon Sauce.

title: Hawaiian Shrimp Truck Special (Garlic Lemon Butter Shrimp).

instructions: ['Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Once hot use a slotted spoon to scoop the shrimp out of the marinade and into the hot skillet, season with salt and pepper. Make sure to scoop up all the garlic as well. Saute the shrimp until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove the shrimp from the pan leaving the garlic in the skillet. Add the salted butter and 1 teaspoon pepper (or more or less to your taste) to the skillet. Cook the garlic in the butter until it begins to caramelize and turn golden brown. Remove from the heat and stir in 1 tablespoon chopped parsley, the juice of 1/2  a lemon and zest if using. Drizzle with the warm garlic butter over the shrimp. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley.']

title: Phyllo Bake
ingredients: ['olive oil', 'spicy Italian chicken sausage', 'eggs', 'kalamata olives', 'oil packed sun dried tomatoes*', 'package frozen spinach', 'greek yogurt', 'chopped fresh basil', 'chopped fresh thyme leaves', 'black pepper', 'salt', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'shredded Havarti cheese', 'cheddar cheese', 'mozzarella cheese shredded', 'phyllo pastry sheets', 'canola oil or butter']
ingredients with measurement: {'olive oil': '1', 'spicy Italian chicken sausage': '1', 'eggs': '5', 'kalamata olives': '1/2', 'oil packed sun dried tomatoes*': '1/2', 'package frozen spinach': '10', 'greek yogurt': '1/2', 'chopped fresh basil': '2', 'chopped fresh thyme leaves': '1', 'black pepper': '1', 'salt': '1', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1', 'shredded Havarti cheese': '2 1/2', 'cheddar cheese': '1/2', 'mozzarella cheese shredded': '1/2', 'phyllo pastry sheets': '40', 'canola oil or butter': '1/2'}
instructions: ['Unroll phyllo sheets and cover with a damp paper towel. Place one sheet in a 13×9 glass baking dish. Brush with some of the canola oil. Add eight additional phyllo sheets, brushing each with canola oil. Spread half of the cheddar cheese over the top of the dough. Dollop half of the spinach sausage mixture over the cheese and then top with half the Havarti cheese and half of the olives. Layer and brush with butter nine more sheets phyllo dough. Spread with the rest of the cheddar cheese and then the rest of the spinach sausage mixture. Top with the remaining Havarti Cheese and olives. Layer and brush with canola oil eight more sheets phyllo dough. Top with mozzarella cheese . Layer remaining phyllo sheets on top, brushing each with canola oil.']

title: Simple Pasta Dough
ingredients: ['Flour', 'Eggs', 'Water']
ingredients with measurement: {'Flour': '2 1/2', 'Eggs': '4', 'Water': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['Knead until the dough comes together and forms a ball. If your dough seems to dry add water a teaspoon at a time, being careful not to add too much water*.', 'By Hand: Mound the flour on a work surface; make a well in the center. Crack in the eggs and beat with a fork. Gradually mix the eggs into the flour. Using a bench scraper, mix in the last of the flour until the dough comes together.', 'Quarter the dough and shape into 4 disks. Place the disks on the lightly floured board; place in a gallon-size ziplock bag.', "Flatten 1 dough piece and lightly dust with flour, brushing off excess. Set a pasta machine to the widest setting; run the dough through. Fold the dough into thirds like a letter, then run it through again, short end first. Run it through 2 more times, dusting with flour if it seems sticky. return the dough sheet to the board, cover with a towel and repeat with the remaining 3 dough disks. (Keep any dough you're not working with covered.)", "Roll all the dough sheets through the machine again 5 or 6 more times (machines vary), adjusting the machine to the next setting each time. (If the sheets become too long to handle, halve crosswise and proceed.) When you see your hand through the pasta sheet, it's thin enough to cut*."]

title: Butternut Squash Gnocchi
ingredients: ['For the gnocchi:', 'butternut squash*', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'salt & pepper', 'salt', 'egg', 'flour', 'Parmesan Cheese', 'butter', 'garlic', 'Crushed Red Pepper Flakes', 'fresh sage', 'salt & pepper', 'For the gnocchi:', 'butternut squash*', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'salt & pepper', 'salt', 'egg', 'flour', 'Parmesan Cheese', 'butter', 'garlic', 'Crushed Red Pepper Flakes', 'fresh sage', 'salt & pepper']
ingredients with measurement: {'For the gnocchi:': 'seasoning', 'butternut squash*': '3', 'extra virgin olive oil': '1', 'salt & pepper': 'seasoning', 'salt': '1/2', 'egg': '2', 'flour': '4', 'Parmesan Cheese': '1/2', 'butter': '4', 'garlic': '1', 'Crushed Red Pepper Flakes': '1', 'fresh sage': '7-8'}
instructions: ['Place squash in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook (or just mix in a large bowl by hand) add in whisked egg and salt. Add flour, 1 cup at a time, and knead until the dough pulls away from the side of the bowl. Add 1/2 cup of parmesan cheese and knead until combined. Turn out onto a heavily floured surface and knead until dough comes together. Dough will be sticky, just keep flouring hands lightly. I also like to sprinkle in some parmesan cheese in place of some of the flour.', 'Remove large chunks of the dough then roll into a rope and cut into 1 inch sections to form the gnocchi. Place onto a wax paper, cover until ready to boil.', 'For the Sauce: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat, then add garlic and sage. Cook until garlic is just starting to turn golden brown, be careful you do not want to burn your garlic.']

title: Crispy Honey Ginger Salmon Bowls
ingredients: ['tamari or soy sauce', 'fish sauce', 'honey', 'fresh grated ginger', 'chili paste', 'salmon filets, cut into chunks', 'salted butter', 'garlic, chopped', 'cooked rice', 'diced mango', 'ripe peach, diced', 'candied jalapeños', 'cilantro, chopped', 'basil, chopped', 'lime juice']

Add the salmon, skin side down and cook for 3 minutes, until the salmon is crisp. Flip, reduce the heat to medium and add the garlic. Cook another minute.', '3. Pour in the sauce. Cook another 3 minute, until the sauce thickens. Remove the salmon from the skillet.', '4. To the skillet add 1/4 cup water. Spoon the salmon over the bowls of rice. Pour the sauce over the salmon. Top with the salsa and enjoy! I always add extra jalapeños.']

title: Pesto Chicken Saltimbocca with Burst Tomatoes and Burrata
ingredients: ['chicken cutlets', 'basil pesto', 'thin slices of prosciutto', 'Panko bread crumbs', 'grated parmesan', 'burrata cheese, torn into pieces', 'basil, for serving', 'cherry tomatoes', 'extra virgin olive oil, plus more for cooking', 'shallots, thinly sliced', 'garlic, chopped', 'honey', 'fresh thyme leaves', 'zest of 1 lemon', 'chili flakes', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'balsamic vinegar', 'honey']

instructions: ['1. In a bowl, toss together the chicken and pesto, coating the chicken fully in pesto. Combine the Panko and parmesan in a separate shallow bowl.', '2. Working with 1 cutlet at a time, press 2 basil leaves on top of each cutlet. Wrap 2 pieces of prosciutto around each cutlet to secure the basil. The oils from the pesto should moisten the prosciutto, if not drizzle lightly with olive oil. Dredge through the Panko, pressing to adhere. Place the chicken on a plate.', '3. To make the tomatoes. In a large skillet, over high heat, combine the olive oil, 2 cups tomatoes, shallots, garlic, thyme, lemon zest, and a pinch each of chili flakes, salt, and pepper. Cook until the tomatoes burst about, 10 minutes. Turn the heat off. Halve the remaining tomatoes and stir them in with the vinegar and honey.', '4. Heat a few tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium-high. When the oil shimmers, add the chicken and cook until golden brown, 3-4 minutes. Cook until golden brown, 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from the skillet and season with salt.', '5. Serve the chicken warm topped with torn burrata, tomatoes, and fresh basil.']

title: Detroit Style Tomato Herb Pepperoni Pizza

title: One Pot Spinach and Sun-Dried Tomato Burrata Pasta
ingredients: ['oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes', 'small bell peppers, thinly sliced', 'small shallots, sliced', 'garlic, chopped', 'dried basil', 'dried oregano', 'dried dill', 'chili flakes', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'short cut pasta', 'red wine vinegar', 'baby spinach', 'marinated artichokes, quartered', 'burrata cheese, at room temperature', 'fresh basil']
ingredients with measurement: {'oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes': '1', 'small bell peppers, thinly sliced': '2', 'small shallots, sliced': '2', 'garlic, chopped': '4', 'dried basil': '1', 'dried oregano': '1', 'dried dill': '1', 'chili flakes': 'seasoning', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'short cut pasta': '1', 'red wine vinegar': '2', 'baby spinach': '3', 'marinated artichokes, quartered': '1', 'burrata cheese, at room temperature': '8', 'fresh basil': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Drain the oil from the sun-dried tomato jar into a large pot or skillet with sides. Set the tomatoes aside.', '2. Set the pot over medium-high heat. Add the bell peppers, shallots, garlic, basil, oregano, dill, chili flakes, salt, and pepper. Cook until the peppers deeply soften and the garlic is fragrant, 5 minutes. Add 4 cups water. Bring to a boil, add the pasta, and cook, stirring often, until the pasta is al dente, 7 minutes.', '3. Stir in the vinegar, spinach, artichokes, and sun-dried tomatoes. Break the burrata over the pasta. Remove from the heat and let sit 2-3 minutes, then gently stir until the cheese is melty.', '4. Serve immediately topped with lots of fresh basil. Enjoy!']

title: Greek Olive Pasta Salad
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'lemon juice', 'red wine vinegar', 'tahini or mayo', 'dijon mustard', 'honey', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'shallots, thinly sliced', 'mixed fresh herbs', 'pine nuts', 'chili flakes', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'short cut pasta', 'mixed Greek olives, pitted', 'bell peppers, chopped', 'chopped cucumber', 'cherry tomatoes, halved', 'canned chickpeas, drained', 'sliced pepperoncini', 'feta cheese, crumbled']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '1/4', 'lemon juice': '3', 'red wine vinegar': '3', 'tahini or mayo': '2', 'dijon mustard': '2', 'honey': '2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'shallots, thinly sliced': '2', 'mixed fresh herbs': '1/2', 'pine nuts': '2', 'chili flakes': 'seasoning', 'short cut pasta': '1', 'mixed Greek olives, pitted': '3/4', 'bell peppers, chopped': '2', 'chopped cucumber': '1', 'cherry tomatoes, halved': '1', 'canned chickpeas, drained': '1', 'sliced pepperoncini': '1/4', 'feta cheese, crumbled': '8'}
instructions: ['1. To make the dressing. Combine all ingredients in a glass jar and whisk until smooth. Taste and adjust the salt and pepper.', '2. To make the salad. Combine the shallots, pine nuts, herbs, and chili flakes in a large bowl. Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat until it begins to sizzle. Pour the hot oil over the shallots.', '3. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Boil the pasta to al dente, according to package directions. Drain. Add the pasta to the bowl with the oil. Add the olives, peppers, tomatoes, chickpeas, and pepperoncini. Pour over the dressing and toss well. Add the feta.', '4. Serve the salad warm or cold and enjoy!']

title: Chili Crisp Chicken Mango Cucumber Rice Bowl
ingredients: ['mango, diced', 'Persian cucumbers, chopped', 'Serrano or jalapeño pepper, seeded and sliced', 'fresh cilantro chopped', 'fresh mint or basil, torn', 'green onions, chopped', 'mixed sesame and/or sunflower seeds', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'apple cider vinegar', 'lime juice', 'avocado, cubed', 'boneless skinless chicken breasts or thighs, thinly sliced', 'cornstarch or arrowroot powder', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'Thai red curry paste', 'fish sauce, tamari sauce, or soy sauce', 'salted butter', 'garlic, chopped', 'chili flakes', 'cooked rice']
ingredients with measurement: {'mango, diced': '1', 'Persian cucumbers, chopped': '2', 'Serrano or jalapeño pepper, seeded and sliced': '1', 'fresh cilantro chopped': '1/2', 'fresh mint or basil, torn': '3', 'green onions, chopped': '2', 'mixed sesame and/or sunflower seeds': '3', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'apple cider vinegar': '2', 'lime juice': '2', 'avocado, cubed': '1', 'boneless skinless chicken breasts or thighs, thinly sliced': '1 1/2', 'cornstarch or arrowroot powder': '1', 'Thai red curry paste': '1/4', 'fish sauce, tamari sauce, or soy sauce': '1', 'salted butter': '6', 'garlic, chopped': '3-4', 'chili flakes': 'seasoning', 'cooked rice': '3-4'}
instructions: ['1. \xa0To make the salad. Combine the mango, cucumbers, serrano pepper, cilantro, basil, and green onions in a bowl. Toss with olive oil, vinegar, and lime juice, and season with salt. Add the avocado and toss lightly. Sprinkle the sesame and/or sunflower seeds overtop.', '2. In a bowl, toss together the chicken and cornstarch (or arrowroot powder).', '3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the Thai red curry paste and cook 1-2 minutes, until fragrant. Add the chicken and toss to coat in the curry paste. Cook until the chicken becomes crispy, about 8 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the fish sauce or tamari/soy sauce.', '4. Meanwhile, in a small skillet melt together the butter, garlic, and a pinch of chili flakes. Cook until the butter is browning and the garlic crisps.', '5. Spoon the chicken over the bowls of rice. Pour the garlic chili butter over the chicken. Top with the mango salad. Enjoy!']

title: Crispy Cheese Chicken Tacos with Avocado Cilantro Sauce
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'ground chicken, beef, or turkey', 'yellow onion chopped', 'chipotle chili powder', 'ground cumin', 'garlic powder', 'red enchilada sauce', 'kosher salt', 'shredded Mexican cheese', 'flour or corn tortillas', 'jalapeños, sliced', 'avocado', 'salsa verde', 'plain Greek yogurt or sour cream', 'lime juice', 'honey', 'fresh cilantro']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'ground chicken, beef, or turkey': '1', 'yellow onion chopped': '1', 'chipotle chili powder': '2', 'ground cumin': '1', 'garlic powder': '1', 'red enchilada sauce': '3/4', 'kosher salt': '1', 'shredded Mexican cheese': '2', 'flour or corn tortillas': '12', 'jalapeños, sliced': '1-2', 'avocado': '1', 'salsa verde': '1/3', 'plain Greek yogurt or sour cream': '1/4', 'lime juice': '3', 'honey': '2', 'fresh cilantro': '1/3'}
instructions: ['1. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over high heat. Add the meat and onion. Cook, breaking up the meat as it cooks, until browned, about 5 minutes. Add the chipotle chili powder, cumin, garlic powder and salt. Add the enchilada sauce. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer until the sauce has thickened slightly around the meat, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat.', '2. To make the avocado sauce. Combine all ingredients in a blender, blend until creamy. Season with salt.', '3. To make the tacos. Layer the meat and a sprinkle of cheese to one side of the tortilla. Try not to over stuff the tacos. Fold the tortilla over the ingredients. Repeat with remaining tortillas and ingredients.', '4. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Arrange 2-3 jalapeño slices in a line in the skillet. Sprinkle over 1/3 cup cheese in 3-4 inch circle/square. Place 1 taco to 1 side of the cheese round. Cook 3-5 minutes. When the cheese starts to crisp on the bottom, use a spatula to gently wrap the taco up in the cheese. Continue to cook 3-4 minutes, until crisped all over.', '5. Serve warm with avocado sauce and any amount of desired toppings, whatever you love!']

title: Sheet Pan Greek Meatballs and Tzatzik
ingredients: ['ground lamb, beef, or chicken', 'shallots, chopped', 'fresh parsley, chopped', 'fresh oregano, chopped', 'sweet or regular paprika', 'dijon mustard', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'chili flakes', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'medium sweet potatoes, cut into matchsticks', 'Tzakiki sauce', 'lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, and pitas, for serving', 'lemon, halved', 'garlic cloves, smashed', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'red wine vinegar', 'mixed fresh herbs, parsley, dill, and or mint, chopped', 'pitted Greek olives, torn', 'chopped pepperoncini', 'crumbled feta']
ingredients with measurement: {'ground lamb, beef, or chicken': '1 1/2', 'shallots, chopped': '2', 'fresh parsley, chopped': '1/2', 'fresh oregano, chopped': '1/4', 'sweet or regular paprika': '2', 'dijon mustard': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'chili flakes': 'seasoning', 'extra virgin olive oil': '1/3', 'medium sweet potatoes, cut into matchsticks': '2', 'Tzakiki sauce': '1-2', 'lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, and pitas, for serving': 'seasoning', 'lemon, halved': '1/2', 'garlic cloves, smashed': '4', 'red wine vinegar': '2', 'mixed fresh herbs, parsley, dill, and or mint, chopped': '2', 'pitted Greek olives, torn': '3/4', 'chopped pepperoncini': '2', 'crumbled feta': '3/4'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 425° F. Line a baking sheet with parchment.', '2. Combine the lamb, shallots, parsley, oregano, paprika, dijon, salt, pepper, and chili flakes in a bowl. Coat your hands with a bit of olive oil, and roll the meat into 3 tablespoon size balls, placing them on the prepared baking sheet. Add the lemon wedges and garlic (for the dressing) to the baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes, until the meatballs are crisp and cooked through on the inside.', '3. During the same time, toss together the sweet potatoes with 2 tablespoons olive oil and a pinch of salt and pepper on another baking sheet. Bake 25 minutes, until the potatoes are crispy.', '4. Meanwhile, make the dressing. Whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, herbs, olives, and pepperoncini. Grab the meatballs from the oven, remove the lemons and garlic. Juice the lemons into the dressing. Chop the garlic and mix into the dressing. Add the feta.', '5. To assemble, add Tzakiki and lettuce to a bowl. Top with meatballs and spoon the dressing over the meatballs. Add the potatoes and any other desired toppings. Serve with additional Tzakiki (of course!).']

title: Easy Skillet Chicken Tinga Enchiladas
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'ground chicken', 'yellow onion, chopped', 'dried oregano', 'ground cumin', 'kosher salt', 'red enchilada sauce', 'chopped chipotle in adobo', 'corn or flour tortillas', 'shredded Mexican cheese', 'avocado and Greek yogurt or sour cream, for serving', 'jalapeños, seeded if desired, and chopped', 'diced pineapple', 'cilantro, roughly chopped', 'juice of a lime', 'extra virgin olive oil']

title: Crispy Feta with Lemon Pepper Chicken and Rice
ingredients: ['boneless skinless chicken tenders', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'paprika', 'cumin seed', 'ground ginger', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'chili flakes', 'bell peppers, sliced', 'fresno peppers, seeded and sliced', 'shallots, sliced', 'garlic, chopped', 'feta cheese block, patted dry', 'cornstarch', 'mixed fresh herbs, cilantro, parsley, and dill', 'optional rice for serving', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'lemon juice', 'champagne vinegar', 'honey']
ingredients with measurement: {'boneless skinless chicken tenders': '1', 'extra virgin olive oil': '1/3', 'paprika': '2', 'cumin seed': '2', 'ground ginger': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'chili flakes': 'seasoning', 'bell peppers, sliced': '4', 'fresno peppers, seeded and sliced': '1-2', 'shallots, sliced': '2', 'garlic, chopped': '4', 'feta cheese block, patted dry': '1', 'cornstarch': '1/4', 'mixed fresh herbs, cilantro, parsley, and dill': '3/4', 'optional rice for serving': 'seasoning', 'lemon juice': '2', 'champagne vinegar': '1', 'honey': '2'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 425° F.', '2. On a baking sheet, toss together the chicken, 3 tablespoons olive oil, paprika, cumin, ginger, and a pinch each of salt, pepper, and chili flakes. Add the bell peppers, fresno, shallots, and garlic and toss with the chicken. Bake 25 minutes, until cooked through.', '3. Meanwhile, make the feta. Add the cornstarch to a shallow bowl. Add the block of feta and toss to coat all sides. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the feta and cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side, until golden and crisp. Transfer the feta to a plate.', '4. To make the vinaigrette, combine all ingredients in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper.', "5. Serve the chicken and peppers topped with fresh herbs. Break the crispy feta overtop. Pour over the vinaigrette. I'd add rice, then enjoy!"]

title: Cauliflower “Pepperoni” Cheese Pizza
ingredients: ['cauliflower, cut into florets', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'smoked paprika', 'chili flakes', 'fennel seeds', 'mustard seeds', 'onion powder', 'garlic powder', 'kosher salt', 'shallots, sliced', 'pizza dough, at room temperature', 'marinara sauce', 'shredded mozzarella cheese', 'shredded provolone cheese', 'grated parmesan cheese']
ingredients with measurement: {'cauliflower, cut into florets': '1', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'smoked paprika': '1', 'chili flakes': '1-2', 'fennel seeds': '1', 'mustard seeds': '1', 'onion powder': '1', 'garlic powder': '1', 'kosher salt': 'seasoning', 'shallots, sliced': '2', 'pizza dough, at room temperature': '1/2', 'marinara sauce': '1', 'shredded mozzarella cheese': '3/4', 'shredded provolone cheese': '3/4', 'grated parmesan cheese': '1/4'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 425° F. On a baking sheet, toss together the olive oil, cauliflower, paprika, chili flakes, fennel seeds, mustard seeds, onion powder, garlic powder, and salt. Add the shallots. Toss well to evenly coat. Transfer to the oven and roast for 15-20 minutes, or until tender.', '2. Rub a large baking sheet with olive oil. Increase the oven temp to 450° F.', '3. On a lightly floured surface, push the dough out until it\'s pretty thin (about a 10-12 inch circle). Transfer the dough to the prepared baking sheet. Spread on the marinara sauce, add the cheeses, then arrange the shallots and cauliflower "pepperoni" over the cheese.', '4. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until the crust is golden and the cauliflower is crisp. Remove from the oven and top with fresh basil. Slice and enjoy!']

title: Cheesy Green Chile and Avocado Rice Quesadillas
ingredients: ['poblano peppers', 'serrano or jalapeño peppers', 'garlic, lightly smashed', 'fresh cilantro, chopped', 'green onions, chopped', 'lime juice', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'sea salt', 'large flour tortillas', 'avocados, mashed', 'rice, cooked', 'salsa verde', 'shredded Mexican cheese', 'greek yogurt, or sour cream, for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'poblano peppers': '2', 'serrano or jalapeño peppers': '1-2', 'garlic, lightly smashed': '1', 'fresh cilantro, chopped': '1', 'green onions, chopped': '2', 'lime juice': '1', 'extra virgin olive oil': '4', 'sea salt': 'seasoning', 'large flour tortillas': '4-6', 'avocados, mashed': '2', 'rice, cooked': '1', 'salsa verde': '1/2', 'shredded Mexican cheese': '1 1/2', 'greek yogurt, or sour cream, for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the broiler to high. Arrange the poblanos, serrano peppers, and garlic on a baking sheet. Broil 2 minutes, until charring. Flip and broil 2-4 more minutes, until the peppers are charred. Watch the garlic closely.', '2. To make the salsa. If desired, de-seed the serrano pepper, then slice, add to a small bowl. Finely chop or mash the garlic and add to the bowl with the peppers. Add the cilantro, green onion, 2 tablespoons olive oil, lime juice, and a pinch of salt.', '3. Grab the poblanos, peel away any charred skin, de-seed, and thinly slice them.', '4. To assemble, layer cheese, rice, avocado, and poblanos on one half of a tortilla. Drizzle over the salsa verde, then sprinkle over more cheese. Fold the tortilla over to cover everything.', '5. Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a skillet, add 1 quesadilla, and cook 2-3 minutes per side until crisp and golden brown. Serve warm with cilantro, chile salsa, and a dollop of Greek yogurt.']

title: Lemon Butter Chicken Piccata with Pesto Polenta
ingredients: ['chicken cutlets, or 2 boneless chicken breasts, sliced in half horizontally', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'all-purpose flour', 'grated parmesan', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'dry white wine, such as Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc', 'fresh lemon juice', 'salted butter', 'asparagus, ends trimmed', 'garlic, chopped', 'fresh thyme', 'capers', 'dry instant polenta', 'salted butter', 'basil pesto', 'grated parmesan']
ingredients with measurement: {'chicken cutlets, or 2 boneless chicken breasts, sliced in half horizontally': '4', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'all-purpose flour': '1/3', 'grated parmesan': '1/4', 'extra virgin olive oil': '3', 'dry white wine, such as Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc': '1/2', 'fresh lemon juice': '1/3', 'salted butter': '3', 'asparagus, ends trimmed': '1', 'garlic, chopped': '2', 'fresh thyme': '1', 'capers': '3', 'dry instant polenta': '1', 'basil pesto': '1/4'}
instructions: ['1. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Place the flour and parmesan in a shallow bowl and dredge the chicken through the flour mix, pressing to adhere.', '2. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and sear on both sides until golden, about 3-5 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the skillet.', '3.\xa0To the same skillet, add the butter, asparagus, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Cook until just tender, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, capers, and thyme, cook another 2 minutes. Pour in the wine and lemon juice, cook 1 minute. Return the chicken to the pan and simmer for 5 minutes, until warmed through.', '4. Meanwhile, make the polenta. Bring 3 cups water to a boil over medium heat in a medium pot. Whisk in the polenta, stirring until the polenta is soft and thickening, 5 minutes. Stir in the butter, parmesan, and 2 tablespoons pesto.', '5. Spoon the polenta onto plates. Add the chicken and asparagus. Then spoon over the pan sauce. Finish with basil.']

title: Peanut Chicken Spring Roll Bowl
